{{Infobox person | name = Annette O'Toole | image = | imagesize = | caption = | birth_name = Annette Toole | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1952|4|1}} | birth_place = [[Houston, Texas]], U.S. | death_date = | death_place = | other_names = | occupation = Actress, dancer, singer, songwriter | years_active = 1960âpresent | website = | spouse = Bill Geisslinger (1983â1993) (divorced) 2 children
[[Michael McKean]] (1999âpresent) }} '''Annette O'Toole''' (born April 1, 1952)[http://www.familytreelegends.com/records/txbirths?c=search&first=Annette&last=Toole&spelling=Exact&11_year=&11_month=4&11_day=1&4=&14=&SubmitSearch.x=66&SubmitSearch.y=18&SubmitSearch=Submit Results, Texas Births, 1926-1995] from familytreelegends.com. Retrieved 2010-02-07. The website cites "Texas Births, 1926-1995. Family Tree Legends Records Collection (Online Database). Pearl Street Software, 2004-2005" as the source. is an [[United States|American]] [[actress]], [[dancer]], and [[singer-songwriter]]. She is most recently known for portraying [[Jonathan and Martha Kent|Martha Kent]], the mother of [[Clark Kent (Smallville)|Clark Kent]] on the television series ''[[Smallville]]''. ==Early life and career== O'Toole was born '''Annette Toole''' in [[Houston, Texas]], the daughter of Dorothy Geraldine ([[married and maiden names|nÃ©e]] Niland) and William West Toole, Jr. Her mother taught dance, something O'Toole learned at the age of 3. She started taking acting lessons after family moved to [[Los Angeles]] when she was 13; her first role was on ''[[The Danny Kaye Show]]''. She also had guest appearances in shows such as ''[[My Three Sons]]'' (1960), ''[[The Virginian (TV series)|The Virginian]]'', ''[[Gunsmoke]]'', ''[[Hawaii Five-O]]'', and ''[[The Partridge Family]]''. ===1970sâ1980s=== O'Toole's first major film role was as a jaded beauty pageant contestant in the 1975 satire ''[[Smile (1975 film)|''Smile'']]''; she got the role after doing an impression of a "dead cockroach" at the audition. She also appeared as [[Robby Benson]]'s tutor/girlfriend in the college basketball story ''[[One on One (film)|''One on One'']]'' in 1977. She co-starred opposite [[Gary Busey]] in the 1980 film ''[[Foolin' Around]]''. In 1981, she starred in the [[HBO]] onstage production of ''[[Vanities (TV program)|Vanities]]'', as well as in the TV movie ''Stand By Your Man'', which detailed the life of country music legend [[Tammy Wynette]]. Later on in 1982, she appeared briefly as [[Nick Nolte]]'s girlfriend in ''[[48 Hours (film)|48 Hours]]''. That same year, she played Alice Perrin in ''[[Cat People (1982 film)|Cat People]]'' and in 1983 she played Clark Kent's boyhood first love [[Lana Lang]] in ''[[Superman III]]''. In 1985, she co-starred with [[Barry Manilow]] in the CBS television movie ''[[Copacabana (musical)|Copacabana]]'' playing Lola La Mar to Manilow's Tony Starr. Also in 1985, she had a starring role as Ms. Edmunds in the original ''[[Bridge to Terabithia (1985 film)|Bridge to Terabithia]]''. In 1987's ''[[Cross My Heart (film)|Cross My Heart]]'', a romantic comedy, O'Toole had a leading role opposite [[Martin Short]]. ===1990sâ2000s=== In 1990, she had roles in two ABC television [[miniseries]]. She played the adult Beverly Marsh in the [[It (1990 film)|miniseries adaptation]] of the [[Stephen King]] novel [[It (novel)|''It'']]. She also portrayed [[Rose Fitzgerald Kennedy]] in ''[[The Kennedys of Massachusetts]]'', a role that earned her an [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Lead Actress â Miniseries or a Movie|Emmy nomination for Outstanding Lead Actress]].{{cite web| title=Emmy Awards: 1990 | publisher= [[Internet Movie Database]] | url= http://www.imdb.com/Sections/Awards/Emmy_Awards/1990#Emmy_Outstanding_Lead_Actress_in_a_Miniseries_or_a_Special| accessdate=2010-02-07}} In 1993, she starred in ''[[Desperate Justice]]'' as Ellen Wells. She had a recurring role on the television shows ''[[Nash Bridges]]'' (1996) and starred in her own series ''[[The Huntress (TV series)|The Huntress]]'' (2000). She starred in the TV movie ''Keeping the Promise'' as Anne Hallowell, Matt Hallowell's mother. In October 2001, 18 years after portraying [[Lana Lang]] in a feature film ([[Superman III]]), she returned to the [[Superman in other media|Superman ''mythos'']] in the role of [[Martha Kent]], Superman's adoptive mother, in the television series ''[[Smallville (TV series)|Smallville]]''. She remained part of the show's main cast, though at times in the background,{{cite web| title= Will the Senator From ''Smallville'' Please Rise |url= http://www.zap2it.com/tv/news/zap-annetteotoolesmallville,0,1846978.story | date= April 13, 2006 | publisher= [[Zap2it]]| accessdate=2010-10-01 | quote=Annette O'Toole feared Martha Kent would remain in the adventure's background, but that changed when Martha's husband, Jonathan (John Schneider), died shortly after his election to a Kansas senatorial seat. She has stepped up to fill his term, with ever-scheming Lionel Luthor (John Glover) taking a bit too much interest for her comfort.}} until the end of [[Smallville (season 6)|its sixth season]]. On January 19, 2010, it was announced that O'Toole would be returning to ''Smallville'' for at least one episode.{{cite web|url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/OToole-Returning-Smallville-1013986.aspx| title=Annette O'Toole Returning to ''Smallville''| publisher=TVGuide.com| accessdate=2009-06-16}} On November 22, 2010, Annette O'Toole played the role of Veronica; a middle aged woman suffering from severe case of Alzheimer's, in season 3 episode 7 of the TV series ''[[Lie to Me]]''. ===Musical career=== In retrospect, O'Toole can date the beginning of her songwriting career to events during a car ride after the [[September 11 attacks]]; as her husband [[Michael McKean]] describes it, "On September 11, 2001, Annette found herself without an airline to carry her back down to Los Angeles from Vancouver, where she films ''Smallville''. So she drove a rental car down. The two of us drove it back up together, and on the long drive up there, somewhere between Portland and Seattle, she told me she had a tune in her head." The "tune in her head" became "Potato's in the Paddy Wagon", one of three songs the couple wrote for ''[[A Mighty Wind]]'', including the [[Academy Award for Best Song|Oscar-nominated song]] "[[A Kiss at the End of the Rainbow]]." O'Toole sang "What Could Be Better?" — a song she and her husband co-wrote — for the 2004 [[Buena Vista Records|Disney]] children's album ''[[A World of Happiness]]''.{{cite web| title= A World of Happiness Roster: Annette O'Toole| url= http://aworldofhappiness.com/roster_annetteotoole.html | publisher= HyLo Productions | accessdate=2010-10-01}} In MayâJune 2005, the couple did a [[cabaret]] act for "[[Michael Feinstein|Feinstein's]] at the Regency" in New York City.{{cite web| url=http://www.playbill.com/news/article/92826-Michael-McKean-and-Annette-OToole-Promise-an-Evening-of-No-Standards-at-Feinsteins |title= Michael McKean and Annette O'Toole Promise an Evening of No Standards at Feinstein's | date= 9 May 2005 | publisher= [[Playbill]]| accessdate=2010-10-01}} On July 7, 2007, O'Toole appeared as a backing singer for her husband's fictional band [[Spinal Tap (band)|Spinal Tap]] at the [[London]] leg of the [[Live Earth]] concerts. She has also performed on the band's 2009 ''Unwigged and Unplugged'' tour.{{Citation needed|date=February 2010}} ==Personal life== O'Toole married actor Bill Geisslinger on April 8, 1983;[http://www.supermancinema.co.uk/superman3/general/media/starlog72_1983_otoole/index.shtml 1983 Annette O'Toole Interview] from ''[[Starlog]] 72'' via supermancinema.co.uk the couple had two sons, Nell and Anna Geisslinger.{{Citation needed|date=February 2010}} O'Toole first met [[Michael McKean]], the man who would later become her second husband, when McKean was working on ''[[Laverne & Shirley]]''.{{cite web| title= Interview: Michael McKean & Annette O'Toole| url= http://www.soundtrack.net/features/article/?id=115 | date= January 7, 2004 | publisher= SoundtrackNet| accessdate=2010-10-01}} After both were divorced, O'Toole and McKean became friends in 1997, while starring together on ''Final Justice'', a [[Lifetime (TV network)|Lifetime]] movie.{{imdb title|0161574|Final Justice}} They were married in March 1999. O'Toole and McKean guest-starred together in "Mega", a [[List of Law & Order episodes (season 10)|10th season episode]] of ''[[Law & Order]]'' as a wealthy married couple accused of murder.[http://www.tv.com/mega/episode/9722/summary.html ''Law & Order'': "Mega" (Season 10, Episode 18)] from TV.com The couple also guest starred on ''[[Boy Meets World]]'' as [[Topanga Lawrence]]'s parents, Jedidiah and Rhiannon.[http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0530945/ ''Boy Meets World'' State of the Unions (1999)] from the [[Internet Movie Database]] McKean also played Perry White, the reporter, and later boyfriend, of O'Toole's character Martha Kent on ''Smallville''. In 2011 she starred in CAP21's production of the new musical Southern Comfort, based on the Sundance award winning documentary, by Dan Collins and Julianne Wick Davis. ==References== {{Reflist|2}} ==External links== * {{Wayback |url=http://cwtv.com/shows/smallville/cast/annette-o'toole |title=Annette O'Toole as Martha Kent |date=20070210194813}} (originally from [[The CW]] website) * {{IMDB name|0001578}} {{Persondata |NAME= O'Toole, Annette |ALTERNATIVE NAMES= Toole, Annette |SHORT DESCRIPTION=[[Actor]] |DATE OF BIRTH= 1952-4-1 |PLACE OF BIRTH= [[Houston, Texas]] |DATE OF DEATH= |PLACE OF DEATH= }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Otoole, Annette}} [[Category:1952 births]] [[Category:Actors from Texas]] [[Category:American child actors]] [[Category:American dancers]] [[Category:American film actors]] [[Category:American musical theatre actors]] [[Category:Songwriters from Texas]] [[Category:American television actors]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Houston, Texas]] [[Category:American people of Irish descent]] [[bs:Annette O'Toole]] [[cs:Annette O'Toole]] [[de:Annette OâToole]] [[es:Annette O'Toole]] [[fr:Annette O'Toole]] [[ko:ìë¤í¸ ì¤í´]] [[it:Annette O'Toole]] [[he:×× × ×××××]] [[hu:Annette OâToole]] [[nl:Annette O'Toole]] [[ja:ã¢ãããã»ãªãã¥ã¼ã«]] [[no:Annette O'Toole]] [[pl:Annette O'Toole]] [[pt:Annette O'Toole]] [[sr:ÐÐ½ÐµÑ Ð'Ð¢ÑÐ»]] [[sh:Annette O'Toole]] [[fi:Annette O'Toole]] [[sv:Annette O'Toole]]
